channel.title: John Shed's Saturday Night Shakeup (with occasional appearances from those Who Boys)
channel.description:
The John Shed Podcast - Live (ish) from London.
An evening of good music (mashup, drum and bass, dub, rock, folk, avant-garde, electronic, easy-listening), great lager and dodgy conversation.
With John Shed, Rita Says, Celebrity Chef Simon Collier, Celebrity Photographer Mark Stringer, Celebrity Cartoonist Johnny Cole, Tim Baker (aka DJ NoNo), Kirk Wotsisname, Kyoko Rathmell, LJ, Nigel 'Ripper' Burke, Porno Paul, Celebrity Vocalist Alfie Lee, Renowned Veterinarian Trevor Wilkinson, Celebrity Television Producer Brenda McCorr, Neckice, LV15, Kodek and DJs Mark Vidler (GHP), Pilchard, DJ NoNo, Loo & Placido, DJ Zebra, Dunproofin', FWD and more. Hurrah!

item.title: Show 3
item.description: After a short hiatus due to Mr Shed having a nervous breakdown and needing a break during which he travelled to the amazonian jungles of South America in order to seek guidance and healing from the local shamen, he is BACK WITH BALLS TWICE AS BIG AS A SICK BABY'S SWOLLEN HEAD AND HE IS READY TO ROCK! Yes, it's John Shed's Saturday Shake Up show 4, featuring a story about a jacket and a tribute to Brian 'WhoBoy' Coleman who has just been released from the fraggle wing of San Quentin Prison. Full of the latest, greatest, hippest and happeningest new beat music, it's time to put your polo neck on, don a beret and light a huge pipeful of SHAG. It's Sheddytime... Tracklist 1 are you bored? 2 Uncle- Rabbit in your headlights 3 Mic Check 4 Nervous breakdown 5 covcast 6 Haircut 7 Apeboy-Enya vs Prodigy(lenlow Edit) 8 Marky who boy in da house 9 Richard cheese – Gin n Juice 10 – Back to back 11 Snoop dog – Gin n Juice(Acapella) 12 Revolting individual 13 Peverelist + Appleblim – Circling 14johnshed@gmail.com 15 ThePeterBell500 – Squish 16 A bit like football 17 Strange Pyramid – The WhoBoys 18 The Genius that is Brian Coleman 19 NickNackPaddyWacked – The WhoBoys 20 Marks short Story Time - The wrong Jacket 21 Unkle – Never Never Land – Back and Forth 22 To Much Booze 23 Syd Dale – The Appartment 24 Church Bells and more cheese 25 StereoLab – Get Carter 26 Killed a hare in the Arctic 27 U-Zig Goodbye Goodbye

item.title: Episode 2
item.description: Yes, hipsters and popniks worldwide, it's John Shed's Saturday Night Shake Up, Show Number 2! Brace yourself for a breathless evening of top rhythm and blues tunes straight from the disc jockey's turntable, some challenging chat with John's beguiling guests, and all round generally just the most modern experience it is possible for a young teenager to have in modern Britain! We're sure you'll join in with John when he gives his familiar shout: "Let's Shake it up!" Hooray! 1-Welcome 2-Spizz Energi-Wheres Captain Kirk? 3-Prize Giveaway 4-New York Jazz Ensemble- Linecheck Samurai 5-I like water 6-The Dub Pistols-The Problem Is 7-Henri Mancini -Peter Gun 8-Bad Weather 9-London Crying-The WhoBoys 10-Lets All Chip In 11-DJ BC- Tripper Trouble 12-Pigeons 13-Mark Vidler -Rapture Riders 14-Where Are You Giles? 15-Hallucinagen- Remix(Ott) 16-Lovely Indeed 17-Aggro1-Saturday Nights Alright For Fighting. 18- Interview-The Frunt Room 5 19-Frunt Room Five-Technically perfect(but also really bad) 20-Plums 21-The Flashbulb- Lawn Wake1X 22-Wheres Mark? 23-Steve Reich-The People are the heroes 24-Lean Into The Mic 25-Iggy Pop(David Bowie)-Turn Blue 26-Kick Her Out The Car 27-Bob Dylan-Lay Lady Lay 28-Mark's Short Story 29-Unkle-Cocaine And Camcorders 30-Goodbye. 31-The Who Boys-Mars Five

item.title: JohnShed 's Saturday Night Shake Up With Occasional appearances from those Who Boys
item.description: Off the back of the last 40 shows, we bring you the new John Shed Saturday night Shakeup, with occasional appearances from those Who Boys! ocasional Yes! Rather than waste the immense listenership that those whacky Who boys and Mr Shed generated on the last series of shows, we decided FUCK IIIIITTTT! Let sheddy do a show! The legendary John Shed returns from the dead to speak to you again, yes, to you, personally, through your headphones and into your little head. So press play, settle down, roll a massive doobie, crack open a can and close your tired, bleary eyes while you listen to the new John Shed experience. 1. What you up to tonight? 2. do you want to stroke this chicken? 3. Space patrol-The Peter Thomas Sound Orchestra 4. On the Farm 5. Fool - The Who Boys 6. Email 7. Thats not food! 8. When They Come Around- The Who Boys 9. Good Tourists 10. Wisdom 11. Target Friday - The Who Boys 12. Frunt Room 13. HorseWarp - The Tony Crackburn Orchestra 14. A couple of Degrees 15. Burn Me Out - The Morlocks 16. CovCast (ish) 17. The Bug - Warning 18. Theres ash on the keyboard 19. Dragon on me - Tod 20. Argument 21. Mark's Short story time 22. Cyril - The Who Boys 22. Sorry 23. Both Sides - Davey Graham 24. Account Balance zero 25. Majun (a taste of Tangier) - Davey Graham 26. Nice cup of T 27. The Ghost of Saddam Hussain 28. Interview With Andrew Joseph O' Neill 29. Francois 30. Good Old Who Boys 31. I feel Ace - The Who Boys 32. Spinach 33. Time for a Change - Syd Dale 34. Prick. Goodbye 35. 24hr Chemist - The Who Boys

item.title: Show 40 – Saturday Night with the Who Boys – The Final Show
item.description: Show 40 – Saturday Night with the Who Boys – The Final Show Yes, this is it, listeners – the very final show, and it’s nearly 3 bloody hours long. In which we play every track from our final album of original tracks, ‘Party songs for Outpatients’ – best album we’ve ever done - FACT. To download the album for free, just go www.whoboys.com! Well, 40 shows, eh? A lot has happened since we started this podcast, and it’s been one hell of a journey. We’ve loved it, even though it nearly killed us. And we love you for listening to it – thank you. May you all live happy and joyous lives, and that’s from our hearts. Apart from that bastard Keith in Newcastle. So as of now the Who Boys are giving up music to start painting and filmmaking – keep an eye out for us on t’internet. We’ll be back. Enjoy the show. And remember – never forget yer Who Boys. Over and out. 1. Shermancast 2. Let us flipping have it 3. The original Who boys Theme 4. No more podcasts, no more music – BUT – our final album 5. Jeff Randall is Alive – the Who Boys 6. What’s that all about? 7. English Fat Stupid Boozer – The Who Boys 8. I’m suing you before I die 9. Having a Good Time – The Who Boys 10. John Shed reminisces 11. Blackpool Pier – The Who Boys 12. Grabbing Noel’s balls 13. Just Like They Do In Hollywood – The Who Boys 14. John Shed leaves for Shedland. 15. Because – The King’s Singers 16. My favourite little economic crisis 17. London Life – Syd Dale 18. The Who Boys finally shut up 19. Hurry Up Harry – The Who Boys Choral Society 20. Summat like that 21. Move Move Move – Alan Hawkshaw 22. Proper rave up music 23. She Works Long Hours – The Who Boys 24. Convenience Shopping – Alan Hawkshaw 25. Always remember yer old Who Boys 26. Man With Python In Pants – The Who Boys 27. Using spam for lyrical inspiration 28. Get With The Programme, Mike – The Who Boys 29. Final hello from Mrs WhoBoy 30. Grand Prix – Johnny Pearson 31. Pissing and Shitting 32. Didn’t You Change Your Shoes? – The Who Boys 33. A bit of a scat session 34. Sita Ram – Davey Graham 35. Do you want to be part of my big picture forever? 36. Little Secret – The Who Boys 37. Have you got a little secret that I don’t know about? 38. The Biggest Lie – The Who Boys 39. Four funerals and a wedding 40. Assault Course – Johnny Pearson 41. Can I listen to your brain? 42. I Think Of You – The Who Boys 43. Our last gig in Germany in May 44. Lifestyle – The Who Boys 45. Where you’re listening from 46. Tuna Brine – The Who Boys 47. It’s the little things that drive you over the edge 48. O.C.D. – The Who Boys 49. The rhythm of a washing machine 50. The Hollywood Scene – Syd Dale 51. Very nice indeed 52. Anything You Can Do – The Who Boys 53. It became a bit of a chore 54. Getting The – The Who Boys 55. Hey! You’ll Look Funny When You’re 50 ought to go on the album! 56. You’ll Look Funny When You’re 50 – The Who Boys 57. Here’s another one about lifestyles 58. Cucumber And Milk – The Who Boys 59. Who are THEY? 60. Very Naughty Boy – The Who Boys 61. You be the cheese and I’ll be the wine 62. Java Jive – The King’s Singers 63. So, the last track of the album… 64. Waste – The Who Boys 65. Just like fish fingers, maaaan 66. Very John Shed 67. Mark and Giles WhoBoy give thanks 68. Time, Gentlemen, Time – The Who Boys 69. The 70. End.

item.title: Show 39 – Saturday Night with The Who Boys – The Old Jack Mathers Show.
item.description: Show 39 – Saturday Night with The Who Boys – The Old Jack Mathers Show. On this show we play our only ‘concept’ album, ‘The Life & Disaster of Old Jack Mathers’, in its entirety. We feel this is arguably our best lyrical and musical achievement as a whole album. It’s dark – my God it’s dark – but it’s based on a character we used to see in our local pub when we lived around Holloway Road, London – a very sinister man. This is his life story, in the form of music. It doesn’t really matter what we say in between the tracks on this show, as the show is really all about the album, so the programme just lists the tracks of the album in order. Turn the lights off, pour yourself a glass of wine and enjoy. 1. Young Jack Mathers 2. Old Jack Mathers 3. "He was one of these self-deluded tossers" 4. Mathers in the betting shop 5. Place that Bet 6. "He was somebody who looked like he wanted to kick yer head in" 7. Mathers’ Wife 8 ."I’ll tell you about old Jack Mathers" 9. He Went Down 10. "This became my local when I got out of prison" 11. Mathers’ Memories 12. "He was a malign influence on the pub" 13. Inside the Mind of Mathers 14. "There’s one in every pub" 15. Lonely Hatred, Putrid, Wasted 16. "Some say the guy had a criminal record" 17. Mathers Waits 18. "I remember the smell" 19. "I warned him" 20. Mathers in the Hospital 21. "So what happened to him then?" 22. No one miss you when you die 23. The Legacy of Old Jack Mathers

item.title: Show 38 - The Now That’s What I Call The Who Boys Show.
item.description: Saturday Night with The Who Boys - Show 38 - The Now That’s What I Call the Who Boys Show. Featuring EVERY TRACK FROM THE LATEST GREATEST MASHUP ALBUM BY THE WHO BOYS, “NOW THAT’S WHAT I CALL THE WHO BOYS”!!!! Good Lord Buddha Bebop Belt Me Herman I’m Weeping!!!!! Go get it from our website and take it out into the world, children!!! Play it to your mother, your brother, your sister, your lover, and many many others!!! EH??? Featuring contributions from the Tony Crackburn Orchestra and our backing vocal duo The Crackettes, it’s…oh, too complex to explain! Check out the album blurb on our website! All will be revealed in detail there… 1. John Shed’s Phononica – John Shed and Ananda Shankar 2. Beat Caroline – The Who Boys 3. We’ve blown the genre wiiiide open!!!! A huge curry of sound 4. I Feel Ace – The Who Boys 5. It’s gonna be the album of the Summer!!!! Play yer Who Boys outside yer tent at all t’ rock festivals this Summer, and play it loud ‘n’ proud!!! 6. Flake n Vac – The Who Boys 7. Sheddy been on a march: did you nut a pig? 8. Tony Crackburn – The Who Boys 9. Why the Crackburns don’t have enough money to be here on the show. 10.The Revenge of Dub Auctioneer – The Who Boys 11. It’s not about love. 12. Let’s Go Dino! – The Who Boys 13. YER TURNED THAT MIDDLE BIT DOWN!!!! 14. Frank’s Here – The Who Boys 15. A tribute to our lovely little Sheddy 16. Here Comes Johnny Sheddy – The Who Boys 17. The Who Boys are really different… 18. AudioCline – The Who Boys 19. Never mind the cat! Dedicated to our old pal Linus… 20. Devil is Dead Metal – The Who Boys 21. The bit we originally recorded for this section was so horrible… 22. Sgt Java’s Palava – The Who Boys 23. Doesn’t Amanda sound wonderful on that? It’s waiting for you at www.whoboys.com - dedicated to Jay and the inpatients at the psychiatric hospital in Leicester 24. Dear Mrs Rochester – The Who Boys 25. Special message to our old friend Wax Audio 26. Whoobie Doobie – The Who Boys 27. Giles WhoBoy in Asda the other day…The true story of Jim and Mr Fluffy 28. Dig My Fuck – The Who Boys 29. …about one of John Shed’s neighbours, Mole Man…Paul Weller is in trouble… 30. Loops Inside My Head – The Who Boys 31. Every masher’s dilemma…our only dubstep track…it’s not cool to smoke on the podcast? Jim Morrison swims in my intestines… 32. Hey Lola – The Who Boys 33. You feel like you’re at a 70’s party 34. In The Kitchen At Parties – The Who Boys 35. Nearly had a f####n’ heart attack doing that! Why didn’t Jona Lewie reply to my email? Phil Daniels at my birthday do… 36. Magpie – The Who Boys 37. Your face looked like a f#####n’ blackberry! A toast….The three of us together like the three musketeers… 38. Gotta Hava – The Who Boys 39. I’ve had it up to HERE with war, me!!!!!! 40. Satisfaktion – The Who Boys 41. Off the show, we’re very different people… 42. Shortnin’ Bread – The Who Boys 43. It’s as though we’re all in a distant stormy valley…The BBC theme tune we did…The Who Boys will always be your special little secret…The problem with entertainment…Cock death matinee… 44. Limp Withers – The Who Boys 45. Some of the people we have come to know and love whilst doing The Who Boys – a brief list: Wax Audio, Linus, Tim Baker, Jezz from Celebrity Murder Party, Mark Vidler, DJBC, Flying White Dots, LV15, Mr and Mrs Crackburn, Jim Pilchard, DJ Useo and his wife, DJ Petrushka, Aggro1, VJ Kodek, EBC…There are others too…Schmolli…Aah, there are too many to list – but you know who you are…. 46. Mars Five – The Who Boys 47. We really hope you liked it, listeners…well, that’s it…Tara…A final toast and thanks as always for listening,…SHIT! WE FORGOT TO MENTION NECKICE!!!!!!

item.title: Saturday Night with The Who Boys - Show 37 - The Conversation Show.
item.description: Saturday Night with The Who Boys - Show 37 - The Conversation Show. That's right, my little genitals! A show of flowing conversation, where we just sat down and had a right good natter for 2 hours, nothing planned, nothing rehearsed, took the most listenable bits and interspersed them between the fan-fuckin-tastabulous tracks! for the first time you get to hear what the Who Boys REALLY talk about when they're not trying to say things all the time to impress you listeners... By the way - a nod and a wink to the wise: next show will feature every track from the latest and greatest WhoBoys mashup album, 'NOW THAT'S WHAT I CALL THE WHO BOYS'!!! 1. John Shed tests the input levels 2. Hell's Kitchen - Syd Dale 3. message from Gi WhoBoy 4. online Elvis auctions / Jackson-shit-wall 5. The Revenge of Dub Auctioneer - The Who Boys 6. Shed's little book of creativity 7. White Piggy - DJ Tripp 8. painting is not dead / tube train to Morden 9. Magpie - The Who Boys 10.wanking at work 11. Soul Skimmer - Alan Moorhouse 12. listeners in China / Mark WhoBoy rants on about communism 13. Erghen Diado - Le Mystere Des Voix Bulgares 14. chavs are like lightbulbs 15. She's Nude - Flying White Dots 16. where in England would you live? / Gi WhoBoy's mad mum 17. Fairtilizer 17046 - Aggro1 18. ambishcakes / rock'n'roll podcasting 19. One String - One String Willie 20. LV15 discusses Mark WhoBoy's annoying voice 21. The Dolphins - Fred Neil 22. Christmas dinner with Andy Gray 23. Whoobie Doobie - The Who Boys 24. bad ideas for a painting / my second husband, "The Bastard" 25. Walkin' on the Sky - David Lynch 26. Picasso's wank stain / what's more valuable - the image or the artist? 27. Wicked Wedding - DJ Schmolli 28. mondays, pistols, marketing, hype and drum & bass 29. Come Around (dubstep remix) - Roguestar 30. piano lessons 31. Pianoooo - The Who Boys 32. McCartney sitting in a field 33. My Own Private Patrick Swayze - Male Nurse 34. soul-destroying cutting & pasting / Northern Hendrix / my ducks 35. final message from Gi WhoBoy announcing new Who Boys album!!!! 36. Thugged Out Elves - Spor 37. ShermanCast

item.title: Show 35 - Saturday Night With The Who Boys - The Dogging Show
item.description:
NEW! Subscribe to this podcast and get email updates of when a new show is up!
Subscribe to Saturday Night with The Who Boys by Email (right-click and "open link in new window" if you want to keep this one open)
Wa-frickin-heeeey!!! Here it comes again! The magic, the madness, the muck, the mums and the Marvins! Starring the Who Boys, Mrs WhoBoy, Mr and Mrs Crackburn, John Shed, Kenny and Bhuna! Do you know what? I've forgotten who I am. Never mind that - GET LISTENIIIIIIING!!!!!!! Show Programme: 1. the old WhoBoys Theme returns! 2. Tony Crackburn gets some silly ideas 3. Let's Go Deano! - The Who Boys 4. There's only one Deano! 5. Whole Lotta Love - The Tallywood String Quartet 6. A chat with Mrs Crackburn (Tone's on the f***ing mobile again!) 7. Flake n Vac - The Who Boys + TCO + Crackettes 8. what is chocolocolate? 9. Poetry and all that Jazz - United Future Organisation 10. Mark WhoBoy is put on the spot by John Shed about his disrespectful attitude, and apologises to the listeners of Show 34 11. Troubleshooter - Alan Hawkshaw 12. We read out 2 fab messages from the listeners: Marvin Suicide on his surroundings as he listens to the show, plus J's story from the hospital 13. Solo Busanova - Hugo Montenegro 14. Tony Crackburn gets berated (again) for his taste in music / What Tony Crackburn does in the morning 15. Open Whisky Bar - DJ Zebra 16. Drum n bass n bullshit 16. Lighter (Mickey Finn mix) - DJ SS 17. Piss dilemma 18. Couriers Episode 3 19. Loops inside my Head - The Who Boys (lyric by Mrs Crackburn!) 20. The middle of the show 20. Sex Change - Breakbeat Era 20. Up close with Giles WhoBoy 21. Orgies, a tool of witchcraft - Louise Huebner 22. Hull is dull 23. Billy Bonds MBE - The Barmy Army 24. A little chatty watty with Mrs WhoBoy / A BIG HELLO to Bri WhoBoy 25. Gotta Hava - The WhoBoys 26. Let's close our eyes and have that dream, baby! 27. United Future Organisation - My Foolish Dream 28. It's an extra special Saturday night 29. Thing Fish - Tony Crackburn Orchestra 30. Welcome to Sunday morning with The Who Boys. Mark WhoBoy says something silly again that he doesn't really mean. Apologies in advance. 31. Frank's Here - The Who Boys 32. Mr and Mrs Crackburn discuss their dogging activities 33. My Uncle used to love me but she died - Roger Miller 34. We have to watch the Crackburns very carefully 35. Sgt Java - The Who Boys + TCO + Crackettes 36. Goooooooood-BYEEEEEEEEEEEE!!!! 37. Nightmares - Ryuichi Sakamoto (this is special - listen carefully)

item.title: Show 34 - Saturday Night with The Who Boys - The Sick Show
item.description:
Celebrating the return of John Shed from the neuropsychiatric institute, also featuring The 'Ooo Boys, the Crackburns, all the regular scum and more! Get a bomb out and chuck it at yer mam!!!!!

1. Welcome to...Saturday Night with the Crackburns...? 2. AudioCline - The Who Boys 3. Mark WhoBoy is sick / Welcome back John Shed!!!! 4. Here comes Johhny Sheddy - The Who Boys + TCO, featuring The Crackettes!!! 5. John Shed tells all about his experiences at the neuropsychiatric institute / everybody sings Loony Toons 6. Born to be Wild - Osaru Ondo 7. Dog's Dinner - The Tony Crackburn Orchestra 8. New Drama Feature! Couriers - Episode 1 9. Blue Moon of Kentucky - Reverend Beat Man 10. Mark WhoBoy is still sick 11. Mad Bad Dad - The Who Boys 12. No Squirrel No Cry - g3rst 13. A 'funny' story from Mrs Crackburn 14. Nutria Xray - The Tony Crackburn Orchestra 15. Thanks for Donations Time!!! (where our generous listeners get named!) 16. Loud Minority - United Future Organisation 17. Welcome to Sunday Morning with The Who Boys - Mark WhoBoy returns, back from the dead and well again!! Let's get rockin'! 18. Rocky Mountain Runabout - Alan Hawkshaw 19. Marky WhoBoy has a fab little chat with Johnny Sheddy! 20. New Lifestyle feature! Weekend Wines with Hugh Boyd 21. Continuum - Cinematic Orchestra 22. Here we are again - Mark and Gi WhoBoy have a bit of a good old chat, and introduce something special: 23. Factory Stench - 'Mr WhoBrother' 24. Powerful stuff. Let's get him on the show. 25. Caravan - Bert Kaempfert & his Orchestra 26. A little chat with Tone. 27. Letter from God to man - Dan Le Sac and Scroobius Pip 28. Tony Crackburn has a moan about Mark WhoBoy and gets punished for it, because Marky WhoBoy is back to FULL STRENGTH AND READY TO DEAL WITH ALL HIS ENEMIES!!! 29. The Devil is Dead Metal - The Who Boys + The Tony Crackburn Orchestra + The Crackettes 30. cONCEPTUAL FUCKIN' FOCUS! 31. Bluebird Blackout - Phil Retrospector (bloody hell - beautiful!) 32. What is conceptual focus? A brief explanation by Mark WhoBoy. 33. Twin Hearts - Collatron 34. A little chat with Mrs Crackburn 35. Perhaps we dub it up in a precinct - The Tony Crackburn Orchestra 36. Couriers - Episode 2 37. Why does the show have to be over all of a sudden? 38. Coco Grace - Reverend Beat Man 39. Thursday afternoon with The Who Boys! 40. Roger's Back (edited) - The Roger Tubesound Ensemble 41. Welcome to Friday morning with The Who Boys! 42. The National Institute for Clinical Excellence - Highflats 43. ShermanCast - Celine Cunting Dion?!! the has-been crap in Vegas must die. painfully. 44. Earache My Eye - Cheech & Chong Featuring Alice Bowie 45. Cocktails for Two - Spike Jones & His City Slickers

item.title: Saturday Night with The Who Boys - Show 32 - The Incontinence Show
item.description: Hello my favourite little syringes! Here it comes again! Show 32 of Saturday Night with The Who Boys - The Incontinence Show! Featuring Mr and Mrs Crackburn, The Who Boys and Mrs WhoBoy, and recorded over a wonderful weekend at Crackburn Towers, Twyford. 1. No country for old Who Boys 2. Mowhawks - Studio 69 3. are you a druggy? 4. The Who Boys + Tony Crackburn Orchestra - Limp Withers 5. a sixteenth? 6. The Scottmen - The Good Word 7. this month's show is broadcasting from crackburn mansions in twyford 8. Tony Crackburn Orchestra - RaconWolf 9. i scream you scream we all scream for ice cream 10. DJ Lumpy - Flat Sandman (with ice-cream) 11. a special hello to dj lumpy 12. Simon Park Orchestra - Up to Date 13. marky whoboy and gi whoboy smoking in the cinema 14. Pilchard - Cat Twin 15. Tony's puffin story 16. Xahdrez - Two Little Boys Died 17. a chat with mrs whoboy 18. Mrs WhoBoy - Perfect Men 19. can you spare the who boys a quid? 20. Stenchman - On the road again 21. a few aperitifs in the lawn 22. The Who Boys + Tony Crackburn Orchestra - (in the) Kitchen at Parties 23. a word with mrs crackburn about mr crackburn's incontinence 24. Tony Crackburn - Dirty Drainwater 25. tony crackburn discusses his incontinence 26. Mrs. Crackburn - And do you know what he says? 27. The Bug ft Ricky Ranking - Murder We 28. crackburn mansions gives the who boys the bloody creeps 29. the Ukelele orchestra - My Baby 30. what do they have condoms in the kitchen for? 31. The Who Boys + Tony Crackburn Orchestra - Yeh Yeh 32. Mark Vidler - Grandstand Supreme 33. Mark WhoBoy - Mashup United manager 34. a wee chat about a talented young man called Phil Retrospector 35. Phil Retrospector - Beatlemania 36. call and response session 37. Wevie Stonder - Cheese Rider 38. what does easy listening mean to you? 39. Johnny Pearson & his Orchestra - The Rat Catchers (with mark whoboy and tony crackburn soaring through the sky) 40. you've ruined that track now! 41. Mrs. Crackburn - Drum n Haack 42. the crackburns are tired 43. Phil Retrospector - Nancy gets Banged 44. torturing the crackburns 45. The Who Boys - I think of you 46. Bye Byyyyyyyyyyyyyyeeeeeeeeeeee!!!!! 47. The Who Boys - Dear Mrs. Rochester 48. SHERMANCAST! Featuring: Seven Dirty Pushers (Squarepusher vs George Carlin) by Bri WhoBoy!!!!

item.title: Show 27 - Saturday Night with The Who Boys - 15.12.07 - The Not Really Xmas Show
item.description:
Show 27 – Saturday Night with The Who Boys – The Not Really Xmas Show Download HERE (right-click and "save as") or with the download link at the bottom of this podcast.
Click here to get your own player.

Show 27 – Saturday Night with The Who Boys – The Not Really Xmas Show In STEREO with new super deluxe stereo condenser microphone! Even the SPEAKING BITS!!! 1. ow much I’m free – celebrity murder party 2. hahahahahaha 3. mashin on the motorway – dj shadow 4. heh 5. venus no 17 – squarepusher 6. possibly the last who boys gig ever 7. cigarette – the who boys 8. john shed arrives and apologises yet again 9. I feel ace (finished version!) – the who boys 10. songs by the undertones and feargal sharkey 11. safe in mind – unkle feat. Josh horn 12. explaining basic semantics to john shed 13. the plot – roy budd 14. red wine by ub20 by who boys and sheddy 15. dumb paranoia – celebrity murder party 16. shed demands a song that won’t be played 17. space truckin’ – deep purple 18. mark whoboy gives john shed advice on his relationship problems 19. night train – alvino rey 20. more advice from mark whoboy to john shed over his bloody relationship problems 21. john shed’s blues – john shed 22. colours – Donovan 23. ernest grattan – the who boys 24. the killer – lalo schiffrin 25. country life – the who boys 26. chocolate lovely – amon tobin 27. 99p microphone 28. inglan is a bitch – linton kwesi Johnson 29. ZOEY STOP PLAYING F****ING HEAD GAMES WITH ME!!!!!!! 30. residents intro 31. here I come Constantinople – the residents 32. a toast and a bit of george Formby 33. the man from thrush – lalo schiffrin 34. shed gets his head kicked in 35. nimoy and eastwood 36. blank images – the viewers 37. Christmas message from the who boys 38. the lion in winter – john barrie 39. ShermanCast - no limey scrooges allowed 40. jingle bells - les paul 41. Xmas in NYC - DJ le clown 42. pretty paper - roy orbison 43. more rock, less talk. oh yeah. 44. hey mr santa - DJ riko featuring marcie 45. missing my lovely limey mates 46. christmas lullaby - shane mcgowan & the popes 47. what I would have said to that bloke 48. baby it's cold outside - dean martin 49. see you next year you lovely people 50. please come home for christmas - charles brown 51. we three kings of orient are - the beach boys

item.title: Show 26 - Saturday Night with The Who Boys - 11.11.07 - The Super Short Story Show
item.description:
Saturday Night with The Who boys – Show 26 – The Super Short Story Show Download HERE (right-click and "save as") or with the download link at the bottom of this podcast. Featuring the usual belting music, 2 or 3 new Who Boys offerings, and… Loadsa great, very short stories by The Who Boys and some of their Special Friends. Waaaaaaa-HEEEEEEY. So get yourself a drink, 20 cigarettes, an ashtray, take your pants off, put the headphones on and join us in our little literary-musical journey. Oh, yes.
Click here to get your own player.

Show Programme: 1. intro: happy go lively – laurie johnson 2. i feel ace (unfinished but bloody hell!) – the who boys 3. [story – “drunk on religion” – mark whoboy] 4. up, up & away – fifth dimension 5. [story – “conversation with terry the fork” – danny pockets] 6. nightmare – bim sherman 7. [story – “children” (developed from a story by mark stringer) – mark whoboy] 8. millennium hand – muziq 9. [story – “kylie and madonna” – mark whoboy] 10. it’s rainin’ – irma thomas 11. [story – “newspaper” – mark whoboy] 12. [story – “facebook” – john shed] 13. one more red nightmare – king crimson 14. [story – “cyril” – mark whoboy] 15. switch – amon tobin 16. [psychiatric office answering machine] 17. eye spy – the who boys 18. [nat west] 19. [“danny’s alphabet” – danny pockets] 20. oh, marie – louis prima 21. [story – “such splendid evenings” – mark whoboy] 22. rene – the small faces 23. [story – “knockers” – mark whoboy] 24. music to watch girls by – john williams 25. [story – “what i do every day” – john shed] 26. cock – the who boys 27. [story – “my little english sheep” – mark whoboy] 28. fire in my soul – davey graham 29. the london royal orchestra - the man with the goldsmith 30. werner muller & his orchestra - a foggy day in london town 31. king crimson - sex, sleep, eat, drink, dream 32. [intermission: all night dj] 33. krazy baldhead - dirrrty samplefucker 34. the moments - you really got me 35. the who boys - you'll look funny when you're 50 36. unfinished mashups #1 of 2000 37. [story - "creditors"– giles whoboy] 38. the bug feat. killa p. and flow dan – skeng 39. [story – “girlfriend" - danny pockets] 40. ex (daevid allen & david tolley) – do 41. lee marvin - wandering star 42. b.c. hilliam & malcolm mceachern - pipe and cigarette 43. [story - "little timmy toppy"– giles whoboy] 44. lalo schifrin – maria 45. [story - "coffee" – giles whoboy] 46. amon tobin – toys 47. the user - symphony no.2 for dot matrix printers 48. how shall we celebrate? 49. the who boys – wanking 50. le orme -- ad gloriam 51. [story - “jack’s revenge” - brian whoboy] 52. Edan feat. Dagha - Rock and Roll 53. [story - “trevor holocaust” - brian whoboy] 54. lars hollmer - starlep signs 55. [story - “ears & cock” - brian whoboy] 56. caribou - after hours ----------------------------------------------------- Tell us what you think with a comment or at our Shout Out page! The Who Boys website The Who Boys Mashup MySpace site The Who Boys Originals MySpace site Don't see your podcatcher on the right? Go to our Feedburner site to subscribe.

item.title: Show 25 - Saturday Night with The Who Boys - 09.10.07 - The ASBO Show
item.description:
Show 25 – The ASBO Show Featuring special previews of work-in-progress tracks for the upcoming original Who Boys album, ‘Party Songs for Outpatients’ (tracks 1, 3 and 25) and one or two as-yet-unobtainable Who Boys tracks. This show also features a new approach, featuring original recorded fiction between the usual BELTING tracks…a little journey through our twisted, anti-social culture, vignette by vignette… Download HERE or from the link below the show programme (right-click and "save as")
Click here to get your own player.

Show Programme: The ASBO section: 1. Shortnin bread 2007 reprise – the who boys 2. the Christmas day incident 3. shortnin bread 2007 – the who boys 4. judgement 5. money generation - eve massacre 6. phone message for sex offender house 7. track 1 – the hammond orchestra 8. basic hygiene and cleanliness 9. Hugh Buoy, secret agent – the who boys 10. lager and piss all over the floor 11. track 2 – the Hammond orchestra 12. threat no 2: I will have him so hard 13. dre the big boss man – guv’nor 14. the crutch incident 15. light my fire – the tony hatch orchestra 16. formal interview of brain-damaged girlfriend 17. bedazzled – the tony hatch orchestra 18. the cigarettes issue 19. 1, 2 (sirens coming) – dj useo vs celebrity murder party 20. another Saturday night with the who boys 21. long daddy green – blossom dearie 22. the fatal mugging 23. tourettes in the supermarket 24. holiday for strings – david rose and his orchestra 25. hurry up harry (choral version) – the who boys 26. threat no.3 – you little grass 27. sunny – bobby hebb 28. she won’t let me go for a piss 29. how are things in glocca morra – Johnny gray & his orchestra 30. threat no. 4: you know what my ambition is? 31. scarborough fair – the harry south stereo brass 32. the bad back excuse 33. mark’s half of the podcast is better than… (a little choral treat) The Coventry section: 34. Smile for the Cameraman, Honey - Snips 12 35. Vex'd - Crusher Dub 36. Hedgehoppers Anonymous - It's Good News Week 37. Bong Ra - Warhead 38. Peter Thomas Sound Orchestra - Jumpin' Jack Flash 39. Sham 69 - With a Little Help from my Friends 40. Smile for the Cameraman, Honey - Snips 15 41. The Monkees - Randy Scouse Git 42. The Who Boys - Mars Five 43. (The Who Boys - On the Coast) 44. American Primitive - Flux 45. Roy Budd - Who Dares Wins 46. Smile for the Cameraman, Honey - Snips 14 47. Spizz Energi - Where's Captain Kirk? 48. Alan Hawkshaw - The Night Rider 49. The Who Boys - 9 to 5 50. Weather Report - Badia 51. You are in my badia – The Who Boys 52. America – cortez and his new latin ShermanCast - from the US (featuring special guest Jeff WhoBrother): 53. The Ballroom - Baby, Please Don’t Go 54. Brian escapes from Godforsaken Limey Land 55. Millenium - Prelude 56. Happy to be in the Good Old US of A 57. The Ballroom - Magic Time 58. item.title: Show 23 - Saturday Night with The Who Boys - 21.06.07 - The Angry Sex Show
item.description:
**Show 24 on the way, after a delay due to John Shed being so drunk that the recording was unusable** Show 23 – Saturday Night with The Who Boys – The Angry Sex Show Download HERE or from the link below the show programme (right-click and "save as")
Click here to get your own player.

Show Programme: 1. intro – seventy six trombones – henry mancini 2. what is mark whoboy angry about? 3. nu rave on – the celebrity murder party 4. what has john shed done recently that has made him angry at himself? Pissing on his own mum’s face 5. the roof is on fire – lenlow 6. god only knows – petra hayden 7. cucumber sandwich / things people do that piss mark whoboy off / how mark fell off the stage at the hope weekender 8. bjorn slippy – lenlow 9. john shed punches mark whoboy in the face for no reason 10. we want your soul – the ghost of saddam Hussain 11. a toast to ‘living the life’ 12. the doors v the crystal method – aggro1 13. mark and john cheer up and greet each other again in a cheerful way 14. when they come around (from the Originals album available FREE at www.whoboys.com – see video on YouTube!) – the who boys 15. what does john shed look for in a woman? 16. levitate me – celebrity pixies tribute - the beach boys as performed by matthew 17. john shed tries to discuss his current relationship 18. bless you, child (from the Originals album) – the who boys 19. mark who boys discusses what he looks for in a woman 20. blackbird – Rosalyn sweat and the paragons 21. john shed and mark whoboy discuss dealing with rejection 22. cassetteboy – cassetteboy 23. approaching women in supermarkets 24. wave of mutilation – pixies tribute – the beegees as performed by matthew 25. john shed describe what a ‘tit session’ entails / how do you feel when you’re naked in front of a woman for the first time? 26. walk on the wild side – henry mancini 27. how do you start to have sex? 28. green lines – alex h 29. mark whoboy describes where the romance comes in / john shed’s dirty text messages / how john shed conducts a date 30. are you being served remix – pilchard 31. comparing beer bellies 32. a stripe is a line – dj moule 33. take a vagina, any vagina…what is it, in of itself? 34. thrush muzzle – pilchard 35. spike from pilchard describes how he starts to have sex 36. not steppa – alex h 37. jim from pilchard describes how he starts to have sex 38. cry when the music’s over – alex h 39. CovCast featuring: 40. kick out the jams – mc5 41. to the taxmobile! – lenlow 42. ShermanCast featuring: 43. My Way – Frank Sinatra; American Band - Grand Funk Railroad; Brown Storm Poem - Vincent Gallo; um 'oh' e um 'ah' - Tom Ze 44. Brian mentions the many tedious and irritating aspects of life in the UK that he will miss upon his return to the US…We love him, and we will miss him. But he is a Who Boy for life, and will continue contributing over the internet. His only escape is death, because we love him too much to let him live outside The Who Boys. ----------------------------------------------------- Tell us what you think with a comment or at our Shout Out page!
